intro: Hetaeria falcatula, commonly known as the flatleaf hetaeria, is a species of flowering plant native to certain regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Araliaceae and is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves that are often flat and lance-shaped. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers arranged in umbels, which are typically borne on slender pedicels. Hetaeria falcatula is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and along stream banks. Its botanical features make it a notable species within its native habitat, though it is not widely cultivated.
